business.headline: From Bollywood to dal-chawal, Mango Millionaire makes money feel relatable'Mango Millionaire' turns personal finance into a relatable conversation, using Bollywood, family meals, and everyday metaphors to explain money matters. It's simple, practical, and feels more like advice from a friend than a finance manual.

Louis Vuitton faces scrutiny over Hong Kong data leakHong Kong's Office of the Privacy Commissioner for Personal Data said on Monday that it has started an investigation into how this happened and whether the company told the authorities on time.

Over 85% of employees plan to change jobs after salary hikes in 2025: SurveyMost hikes fell in the 5–10% range, with only a small fraction crossing the 20% mark. Advertising, education, and IT saw the highest share of professionals reporting no hike at all, while sectors like energy and BFSI offered relatively better payouts.

GST shock for Karnataka vendor raises concerns among small UPI usersThe incident shows why small traders might stop taking UPI payments out of fear. Many would rather handle cash than deal with confusing tax demands. This goes against the government's aim of building a cashless economy.

Affordable homes are vanishing. Can you still get a 2BHK for Rs 1 crore?Real estate prices across major metros have surged due to strong demand, high construction costs, and a steady flow of luxury housing projects. Yet, there are still locations in both Tier-1 and Tier-2 cities where a 2BHK under Rs 1 crore is within reach.
Sensex gains 442 points, Nifty ends above 25,000; Eternal jumps over 7%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 442.61 points to close at 82,200.34, while the NSE Nifty50 added 122.30 points to end at 25,090.70.

Haven't got your tax refund yet? Here's why it may be delayedSometimes, taxpayers claim deductions like HRA or medical insurance without having proper proof. If the tax department finds something suspicious, they may stop your refund and send you a notice for more details.

India now hosts over half the world's GCCs, led by BengaluruFrom cost-saving outposts to strategic anchors, India's GCC evolution is reshaping global operations. As Tier-2 cities gear up, the next big wave might come from smaller, smarter urban bets.

New income tax bill in Lok Sabha today: How it impacts youThe Bill aims to make clearer rules for exemptions, TDS, TCS, and not-for-profit organisations. All this, the government hopes, will cut down on confusion and save everyone time and trouble.
Karnataka vegetable vendor hit with Rs 29 lakh GST notice. Here's whySelling veggies for four years and accepting UPI has landed Shankargouda with a Rs 29 lakh GST notice on Rs 1.63 crore turnover.

Anthem Biosciences share price: Stock lists at 27% premium on market debutAnthem Biosciences stock price: The company's shares opened at Rs 723.05 on the NSE and Rs 723.10 on the BSE. This was about 27% higher than its issue price of Rs 570.

Burger Singh debunks Rs 47 crore funding claim with viral statementIn a statement that's equal parts denial and stand-up comedy set, the homegrown burger chain responded to reports that it had secured a Rs 47.15 crore investment round, calling the claims premature, misleading, and just plain wrong—at least for now.
Sensex opens flat, Nifty below 25,000; RIL falls 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 130.29 points to 81,627.44, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 48.95 points to 24,919.45 as of 9:22 am.

CoinDCX loses $44 million in cyberattack: Here's what the crypto platform saidThis is the second large-scale hack involving an Indian crypto exchange in the past year. In July 2024, WazirX lost $234 million when one of its wallets hosted on Liminal was compromised.

Anthem Biosciences IPO listing: Shares to make strong market debut? Check GMPAnthem Biosciences share price: The IPO opened for subscription between July 14 and July 16, and was subscribed 67.42 times in total. Highest demand came from qualified institutional buyers (QIBs), who bid 192.80 times the reserved portion.

Standard not met: What Astronomer said on CEO Andy Byron's Coldplay kiss cam rowAstronomer responded to the viral video by placing CEO Andy Byron on leave, later confirming his resignation after stating that leadership standards had not been met. The company emphasised its commitment to accountability and the core values it was founded on.
India's rich are swapping gold for bitcoin. Here's WhyNow-a-days more of India's rich are putting a slice of their gold-backed wealth into shiny new digital coins like Bitcoin.

Astronomer CEO Andy Byron quits after Coldplay kiss cam scandalDataOps firm Astronomer's CEO, Andy Byron, has resigned following a scandal at a Coldplay concert which also involved the firm's HR head, Kristen Cabot. In a statement, the company announced the board of directors had accepted the resignation, stating that "the company's standard wasn't met." The New York-based unicorn company, founded in 2018, confirmed that a search for a new CEO is underway. The resignation followed a board-initiated investigation after an incident at a Coldplay event involving the CEO went viral. The board said that leaders are expected to set the standard in conduct and accountability. There has been no official update regarding any action taken against the HR head, Kristen Cabot, who is the Chief People's Officer at the company.

Andy Byron, Astronomer CEO caught in Coldplay kiss cam scandal, resignsAndy Byron resigns as CEO of AI firm Astronomer after a viral 'kiss cam' video with HR chief Kristin Cabot sparked online speculation and prompted an internal review by the company.

Career, kids and a cause: Shloka Ambani shares what keeps her goingIn a heart-to-heart on Masoom Minawala's podcast, Shloka opened up about her journey—balancing kids, career, and a cause she truly believes in.

Astronomer CEO, HR head sent on leave after Coldplay kiss cam outs 'affair'The company issued an official statement two days after the incident, announcing that its board had initiated an internal investigation.

Tata Sons forms AI 171 memorial trust, pledges Rs 1 crore to victims' familiesTata Sons has set up the AI 171 Memorial and Welfare Trust, pledging Rs 1 crore ex gratia per victim and Rs 500 crore in total, to support crash victims, families, and responders.

Sold property and want to save tax? This tax expert suggests a smarter waySelling a property can bring in a tidy profit, but it also comes with a hefty tax bill. Many turn to 54EC bonds to save tax — but tax expert Sujit Bangar says there's a smarter way.

Sensex ends over 500 points lower, Nifty below 25,000; Axis Bank falls 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 501.51 points to 81,757.73 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 143.05 points lower at 24,968.40. Most of the broader market indices also reflected the weak sentiments on Dalal Street.

2025 tech layoffs: Amazon, Microsoft, Google fuel job fears amid AI pushThe year 2025 was supposed to be a new chapter. A time when artificial intelligence promised smarter work, faster growth, and a better future. But for tens of thousands of workers across the world, it has meant sleepless nights, and uncertain futures.

Axis Bank shares tank 7% today. Should you sell or hold the stock?Axis Bank shares: The stock has been on a downward trend in recent times. It has fallen 5.77% in the last five days, 9.14% in the past one month, and 15.27% over the last year.

Reliance Retail acquires Kelvinator to expand appliance businessReliance believes this move will help it grow faster in the consumer durables sector, connect more closely with customers, and open up bigger long-term opportunities in India's changing market.

Explained: Why Wipro shares gained as much as 4% todayThe fourth-largest IT services company in India posted an 11% jump in net profit and a 0.8% rise in revenue—both slightly ahead of market expectations, according to estimates compiled by LSEG.

Stocks, FD or MF? Edelweiss' Radhika Gupta shares 3 golden rules before you investBefore you begin investing, know how saving and investing are different. Saving keeps your money handy for emergencies or short-term plans, while investing helps it grow for bigger future goals.

Sensex tumbles over 600 points: Why is stock market falling today?The 30-share BSE Sensex tumbled 644.99 points to 81,614.25 around 12:19 pm, while the NSE Nifty 50 fell 191.30 points to 24,920.15. Losses were broad-based, with most of the major sectoral indices in the red.

ITR-2 online filing live: Know who can file, new changes and other detailsThis year, the ITR-2 form has a few important changes that every taxpayer should know. You now have to report your long-term capital gains separately for periods before and after July 23, 2024, as new indexation and tax rules apply.

The ULIP trap: Inside India's most mis-sold financial productPart one of our story explores why ULIPs remain among the most mis-sold financial products in India. Sold as all-in-one solutions, they often fail to deliver on either insurance or investment.

Who is Astronomer CEO Andy Byron, caught on Coldplay's kiss camAndy Byron, the CEO of data-driven startup Astronomer was caught on the Coldplay concert's kiss cam with a colleague, and the clip has went viral online.

Startup founder calls flight travel insurance a scam, shares experienceWhat should have been a straightforward process turned into a weeks-long battle across multiple platforms and customer service calls.
Sensex opens 100 points lower, Nifty below 25,100; Wipro jumps 3%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 199 points to 82,060.24, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 40.50 points to 25,070.95, as of 9:28 am.

Will Sensex, Nifty rally today after Wall Street closed at a record high?The US market closed at a record high as fresh data from the United States eased concerns about an economic slowdown in the world's largest economy.

Starbucks CEO ditches 1,600 km commute, buys house near workWhen Niccol was appointed as Starbucks CEO in August last year, the company agreed to a special travel plan. He was allowed to commute between California and Seattle using a corporate jet, as long as he worked from the Seattle office at least three days a week.

Walmart cuts hundreds of roles to streamline operations: ReportEarlier this year, Walmart announced about 1,500 job cuts, which hit teams in its global tech division, online order fulfilment in US stores and its advertising arm, Walmart Connect.
Sensex ends 375 points lower, Nifty below 25,200; Infosys down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 375.24 points to close at 82,259.24, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 100.60 points to end at 25,111.45.
Dalal Street not Asia's darling anymore, says BofA surveyThe latest survey by Bank of America (BofA), shows that investor interest in Indian stock market has dropped in recent months.

entertainment.headline: 5 most popular anime villains with tragic backstories that deserve tears, not hateFrom Naruto to Attack on Titan, these anime villains prove that evil isn't always black and white; sometimes, it's heartbreak in disguise. See which anime villain's backstory is your favourite.

Samantha to return to Telugu cinema with Nandini Reddy's film: ReportSamantha Ruth Prabhu, who was last seen in a full-fledged role in Telugu cinema in 2023's 'Khushi' starring Vijay Deverakonda, will be making a comeback with a project backed by her production company, Tralala Moving Pictures.

Uorfi Javed gets lip fillers dissolved after 9 years, shares video of swollen faceUorfi Javed shared a video of her swollen face after getting her lip fillers removed, sharing the pain and challenges of the procedure. Fans praised her honesty, while others expressed concern and urged empathy for her choices.

TXT drops The Name Chapter: TOGETHER; promise fans 'we'll never disappoint'TXT's latest album, The Name Chapter: TOGETHER, showcases their musical evolution and storytelling prowess. The group shared their ambitions and commitment to fans during a vibrant comeback showcase in Seoul.

Is Ahaan Panday dating Shruti Chauhan? Her Saiyaara review fuels rumours'Saiyaara' actor Ahaan Panday is reportedly dating actor-model Shruti Chauhan. Their relationship came under scrutiny after Chauhan shared an emotional message for Panday. The couple is yet to confirm their relationship.

James Gunn regrets confusion around Henry Cavill's Superman return, calls it unfairDirector James Gunn recently revealed the confusion around actor Henry Cavill's Superman return was unfair. He praised Cavill's professionalism and hinted at future collaborations.

Captain America, Iron Man to be recast as Kevin Feige confirms MCU resetAs actor Robert Downey Jr transcends from playing Iron Man to portraying Dr Doom in the upcoming 'Avengers' film, Marvel plans to reset the Marvel Cinematic Universe with the recasting of Tony Stark and Captain Steve Rogers.
Aamir Khan is making film on Meghalaya murder case: ReportAamir Khan is reportedly working on a crime-thriller as his next project and the same seems to be based on the Meghalaya murder case.

Untamed review: Eric Bana shines in soulful crime-thriller set in the wildRelease Date:Thu Jul 17, 2025Untamed series review: 'Untamed' featuring Eric Bana is streaming on Netflix. The crime-thriller series blends a shocking murder mystery with emotional depth and human sensitivity. Is the miniseries worth your binge-list? Here's our review.

Prithviraj on Ibrahim Ali Khan facing flak: Even SRK gets criticisedPrithviraj Sukumaran praises Ibrahim Ali Khan as a well-prepared debutant in 'Sarzameen'. He compares the criticism Ibrahim faces to that of Shah Rukh Khan, emphasising the continuous challenges actors encounter.

Pushpa, Stree makers congratulate Saiyaara team on success, call film a sensationMakers of the 'Pushpa' starring Allu Arjun, Mythri Movie Makers, and 'Stree' makers, Maddock Films, congratulated the box office success of Mohit Suri's latest romantic musical drama 'Saiyaara'. The film crossed Rs 100 crore worldwide during its opening weekend.

I call him bloody Thalaiva: Mohan Babu on friendship with RajinikanthOver the last fifty years, Mohan Babu and Rajinikanth have shared more than just screen space; theirs is a friendship rooted in simplicity and banter. Recalling their bond, Mohan Babu said he affectionately refers to the superstar as "bloody Thalaiva," a nickname born out of friendship.

I don't rank as high as other heroes: Pawan Kalyan makes startling claimActor and politician Pawan Kalyan spoke honestly about the struggles behind 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu', praising his team and downplaying his own stardom. He said that his movies do not rake in numbers as other films featuring big heroes do.

Vignesh Shivan's Love Insurance Kompany postponed to 2026 due to budget issuesThe release of director ignesh Shivan's romantic comedy 'Love Insurance Kompany' has been delayed. The postponement is reportedly due to budget overruns and production disputes, impacting post-production and the initial release schedule.

Rashmika Mandanna launches perfume brand, Vijay Deverakonda gives a shout-outActor Rashmika Mandanna launched her fragrance line, Dear Diary, on Monday, calling the project very close to her heart. On the occasion, actor Vijay Deverakonda showed his support on social media.

Saiyaara worldwide box office Day 3: Rs 100 crore done, biggest ever for debutants'Saiyaara' is on its way to being a clean blockbuster at the box office. The YRF biggie has recorded the biggest opening weekend worldwide for a Hindi film starring debutants, and a Bollywood love story.

Akshay Kumar confronts fan for filming without permission, later agrees to selfieAkshay Kumar confronted a fan in London for recording him without permission but later calmed down and posed for a selfie. The incident sparked debate online about respecting celebrities' privacy in public spaces.

Vir Das's Fool Volume spotlights Indian crew in global Netflix specialVir Das's Netflix special Fool Volume features 65 Indian freelancers earning first credits. The special challenges western narratives by focusing on Indian creative control and talent.

Drishyam director recalls issuing warning to makers of Ajay Devgn starrerJeethu Joseph, director of the Mohanlal starrer 'Drishyam' movies, recently revealed having to prevent the makers of Ajay Devgn's Hindi version from getting an early start.

general news.headline: 19 dead as Bangladesh Air Force jet crashes into Dhaka schoolA China-made F-7 training jet of the Bangladesh Air Force crashed into a school in Dhaka, killing 16 people and injuring 70 others. A one-day state mourning was declared on Tuesday.

India hit Pak N-warheads depot Kirana Hills during Op Sindoor, claims OSINT expertIndia hit Pakistan's Kirana Hills, which is believed to be one of the storage sites for its nuclear warheads, in a "warning strike" during Operation Sindoor, renowned OSINT expert Damien Symon has claimed. He cited updated Google Earth data to back his claim. The Indian military has denied striking Kirana Hills.

PM holds key meet with top ministers amid chaotic start to Monsoon SessionAs the first day of the Monsoon Session witnessed a stormy beginning, Prime Minister Narendra Modi held a key meeting in Parliament complex along with top ministers, including Home Minister Amit Shah, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, and Health Minister and BJP chief JP Nadda.

Kerala will be Muslim majority by 2040: How a claim got non-BJP parties sparringA claim by Vellappally Natesan, leader of the social service body SNDP representing the Ezhava community, that Muslims would form a majority in Kerala by 2040, has triggered a political row in the state. With the BJP watching from the sidelines, rivals CPI(M), which traditionally draws support from the Ezhava community, and the Congress and the Muslim League, are locked in a battle just ahead of the Assembly polls.
Karnataka vegetable vendor hit with Rs 29 lakh GST notice. Here's whySelling veggies for four years and accepting UPI has landed Shankargouda with a Rs 29 lakh GST notice on Rs 1.63 crore turnover.

Ex-Kerala Chief Minister and veteran communist leader VS Achuthanadan dies at 101Veteran communist leader and former Kerala Chief Minister VS Achuthanandan passed away at 101. He led CPI(M) to power in 2006 and fought for workers, environment, and the poor. Known for his integrity, he inspired generations of Left activists.

Parliament's Monsoon storm: 16 hours to debate Op Sindoor, 12 for new tax billThe Prime Minister touched upon a host of issues, ranging from India setting foot on the space station to the government's resolve of a 'Naxalism-free' country by 2026.

How digitisation can bridge India's Rs 20 lakh cr kirana credit gapFormal credit remains dry for the 13 million-strong kirana network, with shopkeepers largely reliant on costly loans from local moneylenders or distributors

Cash row: Impeachment of Justice Varma moves ahead as over 200 MPs submit motionMore than 200 MPs have submitted notices to Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla and Rajya Sabha chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar seeking the removal of Justice Yashwant Varma, who is accused of misconduct after piles of unaccounted cash were found at his residence.

ED summons actors Rana Daggubati, Prakash Raj, 2 others in illegal betting app caseActors Rana Daggubati, Prakash Raj, Vijay Deverakonda and Lakshmi Manchu were summoned by the ED in an illegal betting app case. The actors were asked to appear in the last week of July and first half of August.

It's simple, practical, and feels more like advice from a friend than a finance manual.

Weighted H-1B visa system might end lottery-based model after DHS proposalThe Trump administration has proposed a weighted selection system for H-1B visas, moving away from the current random lottery model. The change would affect the 85,000 statutorily capped visas and prioritise factors like salary or qualifications. Indians, who make up the majority of H-1B recipients, might be impacted.

ENG vs IND: Jasprit Bumrah will play Manchester Test, says Mohammed SirajMohammed Siraj has confirmed that Jasprit Bumrah will play the upcoming Manchester Test against England, which will begin on July 23.

Centre misused ED, CBI for vendetta: Siddaramaiah after Supreme Court clears wifeSiddaramaiah hailed Supreme Court's dismissal of the ED's appeal to probe Siddaramaiah's wife over the Mysuru Urban Development Authority (Muda) site case as justice and slammed BJP's misuse of agencies. He demanded apologies from BJP and JD(S) leaders.

Video: Mercedes gets stuck in Surat beach swamp as stunt goes wrongIn a video of the moment that went viral on social media, the car's occupants are seen standing helplessly, unsure how to retrieve it.

Cow is a cow: Supreme Court rejects hearing plea on desi milk at Tirupati templeThe Supreme Court refused to hear a plea demanding only indigenous cow milk for rituals at Tirupati temple. The bench questioned the necessity of such distinctions in worship. The petitioner was allowed to approach the High Court.

Chief Justice pulls up lawyer for calling cash row judge 'Varma'A bench comprising Chief Justice of India BR Gavai and Justice K Vinod Chandran expressed strong disapproval as lawyer Mathews Nedumpara repeatedly referred to Allahabad High Court judge Yashwant Varma as just 'Varma'.

Nepal to train at BCCI's Centre of Excellence for T20 World Cup qualifiersThe Nepal men's cricket team will take part in a 15-day camp at the BCCI's Centre of Excellence (COE) as part of their preparations for the T20 World Cup qualifiers.

Lancashire to honour Farokh Engineer and Clive Lloyd with stands at Old TraffordLegendary West Indies captain Clive Lloyd and former India wicketkeeper batter Farokh Engineer are set to be honoured by Lancashire cricket club with stands named after them at Old Trafford in Manchester.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
